docs.title: Good First Issues
docs.text:
• Add a pure function + tests (e.g., utils for formatting).
  • Improve input validation and helpful error messages.
  • Expand READMEs with examples and screenshots.

docs.title: Review Checklist
docs.text:
• Is the change beginner-friendly?
  • Is the code readable and tested?
  • Does the README explain how to run the change?

docs.title: Communication
docs.text:
• Be kind and constructive.
  • Prefer small, iterative PRs.
  • Ask questions early – we welcome learners!

docs.title: Good First Issues
docs.text: Pick one, open an issue referencing this file, and submit a small PR.

docs.title: Documentation
docs.text:
• Add screenshots/GIFs to project READMEs (place files under docs/assets/).
  • Improve examples (inputs/outputs) in calculator_cli and quiz_game READMEs.
  • Add Windows/macOS/Linux run instructions where missing.

docs.title: Small Features
docs.text:
• calculator_cli: Add % modulo operator (update README, tests if added).
  • todo_cli: Add edit <id> <new title> command.
  • stopwatch_cli: Add lap export to save laps to a CSV file.
  • file_organizer: Add --dry-run-summary to print counts per folder.
  • quiz_game: Shuffle question order and per-question timer (optional).

docs.title: Testing
docs.text:
• Add unit tests for tictactoe_ai winner detection.
  • Add tests for dsa/problems/arrays.py edge cases.
  • Add tests for calculator_cli.calculate error paths.

docs.title: Week 1: Foundations (Level 1)
docs.text:
• Day 1: Run level1/guess_number, modify attempt count.
  • Day 2: Extend level1/calculator_cli with % operator.
  • Day 3: Add edit feature to level1/todo_cli.
  • Day 4: Persist laps in level1/stopwatch_cli to a file.
  • Day 5: Add score tracking to level1/rock_paper_scissors.

docs.title: Week 2: Files & Algorithms (Level 2)
docs.text:
• Day 6: Add undo to level2/expense_tracker using backup CSVs.
  • Day 7: Add category budget warnings to level2/expense_tracker.
  • Day 8: Add --preview HTML page for level2/md_notes rendering.
  • Day 9: Add custom rules merging for level2/file_organizer.
  • Day 10: Add opening book for level2/tictactoe_ai (center first move).
  • Day 11: Add timed quizzes to level2/quiz_game.

docs.title: Stretch Goals
docs.text:
• Add unit tests (pytest) for pure functions.
  • Introduce logging and error handling best practices.
  • Package as modules with entry points.

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
• Python 3.8+ installed
  • Windows PowerShell or a Unix shell (macOS/Linux)

docs.title: How to Run (From Repository Root)
docs.text:
• Windows PowerShell: python .\level1\<project_folder>\main.py
  • macOS/Linux: python3 ./level1/<project_folder>/main.py

docs.title: Demo Section Template
docs.text:
Placeholder for screenshot or GIF. Add your file under docs/assets/ and link it here.

Example: 

![Demo](../docs/assets/project-screenshot.gif)

docs.title: Common Project Structure
docs.text:
project/
├── main.py          # Main application file
├── README.md        # Project documentation
└── [data files]     # Optional data files (CSV, JSON, etc.)

docs.title: Testing
docs.text:
Run tests with pytest: 

python -m pytest

docs.title: Contributing
docs.text:
• Follow the style guidelines in CONTRIBUTING.md
  • Add type hints for public functions
  • Include docstrings for complex functions
  • Test your changes before submitting

docs.title: Project Overview
docs.text:
This repository is a curated set of hands-on Python projects for beginners to practice by building. It also includes:

  • DSA Track: small, focused problems with stubs and tests.
  • Python Speed Rush: a 7-day practice plan.
  • Guides: setup, learning path, contribution tips.

docs.title: Goals
docs.text:
• Provide clear, runnable examples using only the standard library.
  • Offer progressive difficulty from basics to mid-level.
  • Encourage contributions via small, well-scoped tasks.

docs.title: Structure
docs.text:
• Level 1 Projects: quick wins to build confidence.
  • Level 2 Projects: deeper practice with files, parsing, and simple algorithms.
  • DSA: functions-first problems designed for TDD and repetition.
  • Speed Rush: daily challenges to build consistency.

docs.title: Assets Guide (Screenshots & GIFs)
docs.text:
• Place images/GIFs under this folder.
  • Keep file sizes small (<3MB GIF, <500KB PNG) and descriptive names.
  • Suggested tooling:
  • Windows: Xbox Game Bar (Win+G), ShareX
  • macOS: Screenshot app (Shift+Cmd+5), Gifski
  • Linux: Peek, Kazam
  • Link in READMEs like:
![Demo](../docs/assets/<file-name>.gif)
